title: Quiz 4: Safe Motherhood & Obstetric Care
topicName: Unit One: Introduction to Reproductive Health
description: Assess your knowledge of the Safe Motherhood Initiative, its 8 pillars, Essential Obstetric Care (EOC), and maternal mortality statistics.

questions.question: What is the single leading cause of maternal death, accounting for approximately 25% of deaths?

richContent.content:
Cause%
Cause A25%
Cause B15%
Cause C12%

questions.explanation: Postpartum Haemorrhage is the leading cause (25%). Infection is ~15%, Eclampsia ~12%.

questions.question: Select the Pillars of the Safe Motherhood Initiative from the list below. (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The 8 pillars are: FP, ANC, Clean Delivery, EOC, Post Abortion Care, PMTCT, Postpartum Care, and Neonatal Care. Education is a foundation measure.
questions.hint: There are 8 pillars directly related to clinical/health care.

questions.question: EOC stands for ___BLANK___ Obstetric Care.
questions.explanation: Essential Obstetric Care (EOC) describes the elements of care needed to manage pregnancy complications.

questions.question: Match the obstetric complication with its specific proven intervention:
questions.hint: Match the drug/procedure to the condition.

questions.question: Based on the timing of maternal deaths, rank these periods from HIGHEST risk to LOWEST risk:
questions.explanation: Risk profile: Labour/24hrs (50%) -> Pregnancy (25%) -> 2-7 weeks postpartum (20%) -> 2-3 weeks (5%).
questions.hint: The time of birth is the most dangerous.

questions.question: Approximately 90% of maternal deaths could be prevented if timely and appropriate quality obstetric care were provided.
questions.explanation: Most maternal deaths are due to direct obstetric causes that are preventable with existing medical interventions (EOC).
questions.hint: Is the majority of maternal mortality preventable?

questions.question: Which programme was initiated to protect the unborn baby from contracting HIV?
questions.explanation: PMTCT stands for Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV.
questions.hint: The acronym stands for Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of Basic Essential Obstetric Care? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Basic EOC includes antibiotics, oxytocics, anticonvulsants, manual placenta removal, MVA, and assisted delivery. C-Section is part of Comprehensive EOC.
questions.hint: C-Section requires a theatre and is considered 'Comprehensive' not 'Basic'.

questions.question: Focused Antenatal Care (FANC) recommends a minimum of how many visits for a woman with a normal pregnancy?
questions.explanation: FANC emphasizes quality over quantity, recommending 4 focused visits for uncomplicated pregnancies.
questions.hint: It is an even number less than 5.

questions.question: Safe motherhood is defined solely as the reduction of maternal mortality.
questions.explanation: The concept has evolved to include maternal morbidity, health of the newborn, and the positive health of the mother, not just avoiding death.
questions.hint: Does it also include the baby and illness?
